today on hot thai kitchen we are making lemongrass 
pandan tea sawaddee ka welcome to the thirsty

edition of hot Thai Kitchen today I want to show

first encountered at a spa and it was served 
to me as a post massage relaxation drink and

it was perfect so I wanted to share it with 
you we are making lemongrass pandan tea or

in Thai nam takrai bai toey nam means water takrai is 
lemongrass and bai toey is pandan leaves which are

aromatic leaves like these that we typically 
use to flavor our desserts much in the way

that vanilla is used in Western cuisine so it's 
very simple simple drink so to be very quick so

I've got four cups of water that I'm bringing 
to a boil back there while that's going we're

gonna prep our lemongrass so you want to cut 
the lemongrass into small pieces to help it

infuse so if you're starting out with a whole 
one you want to cut out the bottom peel off

any yucky bits on the outside and then some 
of the dry top bits now unlike when I cook

with lemongrass since we're turning this into a 
tea I'm gonna use the entire thing because you

know we're gonna strain it all out anyway so 
it doesn't matter if I have way too much of it

I'm just gonna crush it first and then just 
cut them into small pieces you can cut them

into smaller pieces also if you've got any tops 
that you've been saving from cooking you know

you can use the tops for stock and you can also 
throw those tops here to make a tea as well so

that's a good way to use up your lemongrass top 
set that aside so I've got two lemongrass all in

all for the pandan leaves I get mine frozen so 
it comes already cut but a full leaf is about

three times this length so if I put three of 
them together you make a whole one right like

that frozen is usually fine they freeze quite well 
and you're just gonna cut them into small pieces

hmm you know taxi drivers in Thailand put a 
bunch of pandan leaves in their cab as an air

freshener if you go to Thailand you can look out 
for that so and that's it you're gonna drop these

into our tea water so I've got our water on a 
full boil I'm just gonna drop our lemongrass

and our pandan leaves I'm just gonna let these 
simmer for about 7 to 8 minutes usually I gauge

it by the water turning kind of a pale yellow 
color and then it's a really fragrant you can

just smell it when it's ready so generally it 
takes me about 7 to 8 minutes to get there but

if it takes you sooner or longer don't worry 
about it so and that's pretty much almost done

so 7 minutes has 7 minutes has passed make it 
stop there if you can see the waters got now a

is smell it you should smell both the pandan

this stuff you can also just pour it through a 
strainer but makes you want to have a massage

just smelling these things can also put some 
ginger instead of or in addition to lemongrass

so I'm gonna serve this hot but you can serve

because it's not very strong like the nature of

this is either it's very mild so if you pour

oh this is great served with a little Thai pastry
